{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3609717,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-02T15:53:52.766Z","cooked":"

Hey dumb question while itâ€™s bumping around my head.

Are teams still using CameraServer? Or is there something else / a better practice for streaming video to the driverstation / dashboards.

At home a usb video feed was reasonable, but never perfect. But connected to the Field it was not usable

I was somewhat expecting the new 6ghz radios to help alliviate datarate issues. But it could be so many potential things. But definitely a user skill issue is in the mix. It was a later addition in the season.

Would love to hear what people are doing these days. Be it specific hardware, best practices for settings, etc

Hope everyoneâ€™s having a happy friday

We also struggled with this.
I had to manually delete and remake the camera server widget on elastic multiple times every match, and it would stop working halfway through the match ~50% of the timeâ€¦

We used PhotonVision this year and showed on Elastic the stream from one of the cameras (the stream is provided by PhotonVision). It worked with no issues during competition.

I was thinking about desktop capture coprocessor and stream that feed thru cameraserver for debugging. However I had never started that code as the use case is pretty niche. One of the use case could be ROS on coprocessor running rviz.
